def.dt: :a place where people live that is larger or more important than a town :an area where many people live and work major/big cities like London, Tokyo, and Rome ancient/modern cities the city of Boston city dwellers/streets a city government We spent the weekend in the city. [=in the nearest big city] This sense is sometimes used in the name of a city. New York City Mexico City Kansas City
:the people in a city usually singular I think the entire city has heard the news by now. The whole city was excited about the football game.
:the government of a city The city is working to make the streets safer. a lawsuit against the city
:the section of London that is Great Britain's financial and business center

dt.un: used to describe a place where there is a lot of a particular thing or activity Their house was pet city. [=there were a lot of pets in their house] It was celebration city [=there was a lot of celebration going on] at campaign headquarters last night!
used to refer to a particular city without naming it I grew up on a farm, so my move to the big city was a big change. life in the big city

def.dt: :the main or central part of a city :the part of a city where there are tall buildings, stores, offices, etc. compare downtown town centre
:the group of people who make and change the laws of a city He's running for city council.
:the area in a newspaper's office where stories about local news are written and edited
:the area in a newspaper's office where stories about financial news are written and edited
:a newspaper editor who is responsible for stories about local news
:a newspaper editor who is responsible for financial news
:someone who works for a city government usually plural The city fathers have banned smoking in public places.
:a city government's main building usually singular The mayor will be giving a speech on the steps of City Hall this afternoon.
:the government of a city You can't fight city hall. [=the city government always wins]
:someone who lives in a city and does not understand what life outside a city is like city slickers who've never seen a real farm
:a state that has its own government and consists of a city and the area around it the city-states of ancient Greece
:of or relating to a large city big-city problems such as overcrowding and noise a big-city school/hospital :coming from or living in a large city big-city cops/mayors compare small-town
